intro: Leandra villosa, commonly known as the hairy leandra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, leathery leaves. It produces clusters of small, fragrant white or pale pink flowers. Leandra villosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
